newsitem.title: USA: CME lumber tumbles limit on Greenspan statements.
newsitem.headline: CME lumber tumbles limit on Greenspan statements.

text.p: CME lumber futures tumbled the daily limit of $10.00 per thousand board feet in March and May contracts following Federal Reserve Board Chairman Alan Greespan's statement on the economy and risk of higher inflation, traders said.

Greenspan's initial statements that he could not rule out pre-emptive tightening on inflation risks sparked concerns over interest rate tightening which added to pressure from slow cash lumber sales. This pushed prices down through sell stops at $394, basis March, and futures tumbled the daily limit before finding support, they said.
March fell the limit to $390.00 and May the limit at $379.00. At 0916 CST futures stood $7.50 to $1.20 per tbf lower. March was off most at $392.50 and May off $7.00 at $382.00.
Random Lengths quoted cash spruce at $414 per tbf, unchanged from last Friday and up $2 from last Wednesday.
